A historic day in #Gundagai as  demolition works begin on the 154-year-old Prince Alfred Bridge.

The iconic landmark stood as the longest wooden bridge in the southern hemisphere but all good things must come to an end. 

The Council plans to memorialise the mighty structure. https://t.co/fFCaWiAM07

Extending well wishes to Professor @jgermov, who has done an outstanding job as @CharlesSturtUni Acting Vice-Chancellor.

Prof Germov took the helm and led from the front during challenging times and will take on the Deputy VC role at @victoriauninews. #RegionalEducation https://t.co/S54pqQo7o1

Thank goodness for this. Let’s hope this brave little girl is all OK.

Cleo Smith found alive: Missing girl in locked house after 18 days | https://t.co/NxjZj7WDJ2 — Australia’s leading news site https://t.co/6kPZ8QwsHb

Spoke in Parliament to raise the impact of regional & rural bank branch closures.

The Government has established a Regional Banking Taskforce to assess & identify possible solutions to these closures.

#Beersheba was one of many battles our brave Diggers confronted in WWI.

It was an honour to pay tribute to those troopers at the #WaggaWagga service. 

Full address: https://t.co/2REuTdEr6n

#LestWeForget #battleofbeersheba #TYFYS #Australianlighthorse #WeWillRememberThem https://t.co/j0y9QjlvOZ

2/2
These brave men and their horses were honoured today at a service conducted by the Light Horse Memorial Committee and Riverina Light Horse Troop in the #WaggaWagga Victory Memorial Gardens.

#LestWeForget
#battleofbeersheba
#TYFYS
#Australianlighthorse
#WeWillRememberThem https://t.co/3hjmbmNzDx

On this day 104 years ago, Australian Light Horsemen, including Riverina troopers, charged Turkish defenders in the famous World War I Battle of Beersheba. Some 31 horsemen were killed and 36 were wounded.

1/2 https://t.co/O0iIQhwNIX
Many Australians grew up with Bert Newton dominating their TV screens – laughing, joking, horsing around … keeping people smiling and happy. Farewell to a true Australian entertainment icon.

.@MarwaWagga led by Dr Waseem Afzal today celebrated  @OzDayOfUnity with a wonderful interfaith get together on the site of its planned Islamic community centre in #WaggaWagga

We shared a common vision of peace, unity and friendship - as well as tasty sausage sandwiches! https://t.co/IzFWwFuquR

Another busy Parliamentary Sitting is done and dusted. 

I took the opportunity to address Parliament on many topics which matter to #Riverina and #CentralWest.

Enjoy the weekend! https://t.co/WbsqtGG0bC

Honoured to present the Good Talk Bragger Cup to connections of Wise Dragon after a terrific finish at @mtcwagga. Bragger, the 1942 #WaggaWagga Diggers’ Cup winner, set Tommy Smith on the way to racing fame and fortune. Today’s meeting is raising awareness about mental health. https://t.co/tW0dhQ5sqD

If you are studying while living in a regional or remote area, you may be eligible to receive $18,000 in scholarship funding.

Cherries adorn many a Christmas table during the festive season, but #Young 🍒 orchards are screaming out for help with harvest.

Addressed Parliament today to raise this important issue. I urge any pickers to go to https://t.co/7Vst3SkJ95 to assist. 🍒 

https://t.co/gIQNfH8iTn https://t.co/z5fa7uYKHe

From 1 November 2021, people will be able to claim a Medicare rebate for five new Medicare Benefits Schedule items for new Pre-implantation Genetic Testing services provided within existing IVF processes. 

This will help ease the financial strain for those on the fertility path. https://t.co/v7CcChDXku

Those experiencing family & domestic violence can now access the Federal Government’s $5,000 Escaping Violence Payment to help establish a home free from violence. For more: https://t.co/QYojTJAroX

If you or someone you know is affected by a violent situation, call 1800RESPECT. https://t.co/Ed9fztIfvk

30 minutes from the race finish to the stewards’ decision with the runner-up’s protest dismissed, giving ☘️ Irish 🐎 State Of Rest a dramatic win in the 101st #CoxPlate from Anamoe. https://t.co/Qk8tYqrAQk

It’s been a busy and productive week in Parliament.

Spoke on a number of Bills, attended important meetings and got on with the job residents in the #Riverina and #CentralWest sent me to Canberra to do.

We’ll do it all again next week! Have a good weekend. https://t.co/eFLmkimnml

Great @Qantas announcement today with 5000 workers to be back at work as international flights are fast-tracked. Was pleased to play a role as Transport Minister in Liberal-Nationals Government to support aviation industry in challenging Covid times.

✈️ in air = jobs on ground. https://t.co/n47HgjUDWN

More than 70% of Australians aged 16 & over are now double vaccinated.

Please book your 1st & 2nd doses at https://t.co/rJ4HDCqWen https://t.co/tng9UhsSiy

The Stronger & Resilient Communities grant round is open!

Applications close 15 November 2021.

Wishing the happiest of birthdays to one of #Temora’s finest.

Born in #Temora and 101 years young, the delightful Rita Rogers is a town treasure.

An absolute pleasure to speak with Rita earlier today to wish her all the best. https://t.co/AbuOE1XAPf

Executive of @The_Nationals’ Riverina Federal Electorate Council all re-elected at today’s annual general meeting. With chair Barney Hyams, treasurer Margaret Hill (front left) and secretary Pam Halliburton after the well-attended meeting at #Temora. https://t.co/aiCEWoIiyP

Thank you to #RuralWomen in the #Riverina and #CentralWest and indeed across 🇦🇺 on this International Day of Rural Women.

This year’s theme is “Rural women cultivating good for all”. 

Two of my sisters are on the land and doing their part to boost local agriculture. https://t.co/NlWLclC4mu

The #Riverina greyhound community is mourning the loss of one of its giants.

Paul Wheeler, of #Murringo near #Young, was to greyhounds what Bart Cummings was to horse racing.

The 66yo is Australia’s most successful owner-breeder.

My condolences to Jan and the Wheeler family. https://t.co/wZwO3fDqA5

#Lockhart @DemonsFnc Ground function centre is getting an upgrade thanks to a $200,000 Building Better Regions Fund grant.

The building is used by residents throughout the Shire for many community events and they deserve the best facilities. #RegionsMatter https://t.co/9Ntqmqjztx

Good to receive an update on progress of the Southern NSW Drought Resilience Hub from Chairman Barry Irvin, Executive Director @CindaCassidy, @CharlesSturtUni Professor of Food Sustainability the Hon @NBlairy and External Engagement Director Samantha Beresford. #RegionsMatter

Saddened at the death of #League Immortal, Urana-born Norm “Sticks” Provan, 88. A bronzed depiction of the tall St George second-rower adorns the trophy given to the @nrl Grand Final winner alongside the late Arthur “Stumpy” Summons who was synonymous with sport in #WaggaWagga. https://t.co/5x0A8xkViw

The Riverina Intermodal & Logistics Hub (RiFL) is a massive project creating many jobs & will bring businesses to #WaggaWagga on the back of the Federal Government’s #InlandRail project.

The #Budget2021 placed regional Australians at the heart of our national recovery.

A strong and thriving regional Australia is crucial to the future prosperity of our nation and this Budget delivers infrastructure, connectivity, health outcomes and so much more for our regions. https://t.co/VQQKM4Nbjs

#RegionalBudget2021 This Government is supporting regional Australians, building opportunity and investing in the future.

Infrastructure and transport, health, digital connectivity and supporting local business and leaders – we are meeting the needs of regional Australia.
#RegionalBudget2021 This Budget gives a $153.2 million injection to improve connectivity in regional, rural and remote communities, further driving Australia’s region-led recovery.

#RegionalBudget2021 The Federal Government’s continued investment in regional infrastructure creates jobs and fosters economic growth. 

Our enduring investment in transport infrastructure buoys our commitment to a record $110 billion over a rolling 10-year program.

#RegionalBudget2021 This Budget delivers an extra $1 billion for what becomes the $3 billion Road Safety Program.

The new funding will support 4,500 jobs, taking total jobs around Australia supported by the Road Safety Program to 13,500.

#RegionalBudget2021 There have been eight construction projects already completed since our establishment of the National Water Grid Authority in late 2019, bringing the total number of construction projects in this investment pipeline to more than 30.

#RegionalBudget2021 We have committed up to a further $258 million from the $3.5 billion National Water Grid Fund for a new funding pathway which will provide up to $160 million nationally over the next two years to drive the construction of smaller-scale projects.

#RegionalBudget2021 From regional tourism to regional airlines, from small business counselling to export marketing, the COVID-19 Relief & Recovery Fund provides vital & targeted support to industries hit hardest by the pandemic, many of which are vital to regional communities.

#RegionalBudget2021 In 2020, 43,000 more Australians moved from the city to the regions than the other way around.

It’s helping address the sharply rising demand for jobs in the regions – on latest count, more than 66,000 vacancies.

#RegionalBudget2021 Whether it’s the farmers who drove the value of agriculture in this country from $60 billion to $66 billion in the past year or the tens of thousands of workers in the resources sector or indeed our small businesses, it is the regions leading our recovery.

#RegionalBudget2021 Our Government is continuing to provide support as regional communities recover from a tumultuous period. 

This support is not just about immediate recovery; we are also working to help our regions prosper long into the future.

A strong and thriving regional Australia is good news for all Australians. 

This year's Budget places Regional Australians at the heart of our national recovery, post-COVID-19.

Watch as I deliver my #RegionalBudget2021 address: https://t.co/6RVYjQVwrG
#RegionsMatter https://t.co/yEWDY1QEj3

Employment is at a record high, with 75,000 more Australians in jobs than before the pandemic.

This budget will help create a further 250,000 jobs by the end of 2022-23. 

That is our #Budget2021!

#Budget2021: We also need to be prepared for a world that is less stable and more contested. 

That is why we are investing $270b over 10 years in Australia's Defence capability.
#Budget2021: We are providing an additional $1.9b over the decade to strengthen our national security, law enforcement and intelligence agencies.

#Budget2021: There will be a new national recovery and resilience agency to lead our response to natural disasters, coupled with a $10 billion government guarantee to make insurance more affordable in #NorthernAustralia. 

@D_LittleproudMP @keithjpitt @mlandryMP

#Budget2021: We are investing a further $1.1b in women's safety. 

Delivering more emergency accommodation. More legal assistance. More counselling. More financial support, including cash payments for those escaping abusive relationships.

#Budget2021: Our focus is on lifting student outcomes and better equipping teachers. 

$2m to fund preschools with reforms to fund participation and we are also providing more than $19b in funding for our universities in 2021-22.

#Budget2021: Suicide is the leading cause of death in Australia for those aged 18-44. 

We have extended our support for @beyondblue, @LifelineAust and @KidsHelplineAU, with a $2.3b commitment to mental health and suicide prevention.
#Budget2021: The Government will also provide new funding for endometriosis, research into pre-term birth and genetic testing for pregnant women. https://t.co/SwnkwM4QM2

#Budget2021: Our strong economy enables us to guarantee the essential services that Australians rely on. 

The @LiberalAus and @The_Nationals are providing record funding for schools, for hospitals, Medicare, mental health, aged care and disability support.

#Budget2021: Our manufacturing sector will be a key driver of future jobs and higher wages. That is why we have already committed $1.5b to expand manufacturing and backed in our modern manufacturing strategy with an additional $2b in research and development incentives.

#Budget2021: We are making a further and targeted $1.7b investment in childcare. This will increase the affordability of childcare for low- and middle-income families. 

250,000 families will be better off!

#Budget2021: We're doubling our commitment to the JobTrainer fund, supporting a total of more than 450,000 new training places to upskill job seekers and young people. At a cost of $2.7b we will create 170,000 new apprenticeships and traineeships.

#Budget2021: More than 99% of businesses, who combined employ over 11 million workers, can write-off the full value of any eligible asset that they purchase. 

This has seen their spending on machinery and equipment increase at the fastest rate in nearly seven years.
#Budget2021: More than 10 million low- and middle-income earners will benefit from a new and additional tax cut – up to $1,080 for individuals or $2,160 for couples.

#Budget2021: A further $1.9b is allocated for the roll out of vaccines. Australians have already received over 2.5m doses. This budget provides another $1.5b for COVID-related health services including for testing and tracing, respiratory clinics and telehealth.

#Budget2021: Australia's economic engine is roaring back to life.

Since the last Budget, almost 500,000 jobs have been created.
#Budget2021: Ahead of any major advanced economy, Australia has seen employment go above its pre-pandemic levels. At 5.6%, unemployment today is lower than when we came to Government.

#Budget2021 will be the next stage of the Government’s plan to secure Australia’s economic recovery. It will create jobs and build a more resilient and secure Australia.

Growth of regional Victoria has accelerated. 

Almost 12,000 Melburnians moved out to the regions in the June 2020 quarter; but anecdotal evidence suggests an even greater shift.

Take Inland Rail.

Inland Rail, linking eastern Australia from Victoria through to Queensland, will inject more than $18 billion into Australia’s GDP during construction and the first 50 years of operation creating more than 21,500 direct and indirect jobs during construction.

There is a huge societal return for infrastructure investment.

Today, we are building the new regional Victoria, in significant part through the regions’ one third and more share in the national $110 billion 10-year infrastructure blueprint.

.@The_Nationals understand. 

We know what must be done. We’re doing it. We’re delivering.

And with the ongoing support of the Australian people, we will see emerging before us the new regional Australia, capturing living standards and a quality of life second to none.
The Nationals, in our one hundred and first year, are working every day to build and maintain the trust of Australians – so we can keep this momentum going.

The regions are the hot spot opportunity with 56,510 job vacancies showing online.

From the coal miner to the nurse; from the farm labourer to the truckie – good jobs are there, and we’re backing our people in.

The Local Roads and Community Infrastructure Program is moving forward at a pace.

All 537 councils have now formally signed on. This is delivery in action.

Almost 5,000 projects have been nominated across both phases with $450 million already paid to councils across Australia.

This is real delivery for the regions!

These aren’t just nice ideas. They are realities.

Our Party is changing the way Government serves regional people.

We’re building Stronger Communities through small capital projects in every electorate.

Through the tremendously successful Building Better Regions Fund, we’re closing in on 1,000 project approvals.

Another $200 million has been announced for a fifth round.

Never before has Australia seen an infrastructure blueprint backed by funding of $110 billion.

Never before has a full one third and more of this been directed squarely into the regions. Of this $110 billion, $60 billion is allocated across the first four years.

The total value of contracts committed for #InlandRail is now past $2b, stimulating new revenue and growth opportunities for businesses all across Australia.

More than 1,400 contracts with more than 400 different vendors span across every state and territory of Australia.

Regional communications are thriving.

The $380M Mobile Black Spot Program is delivering on the Government’s commitment to improve mobile coverage and competition. Better mobile phone coverage is crucial for people living, working and travelling in regional and remote districts.

We will seek applications of up to $20 million from each state and territory, to be matched by us to rapidly build the smaller water projects across the country.

We want to start and complete these smaller water projects in every state and territory inside two years.

Today, I’m delighted to announce a fund dedicated to building more smaller, targeted dams, weirs and pipelines through regional Australia.

As a strong barracker for the bush, today I was proud to deliver the first annual Regional Ministerial Statement on Rural & Regional Budget Outcomes.

Our #Budget, a plan for economic recovery, will support local jobs, build resilience & strengthen our communities. #RegionsMatter https://t.co/6DiogawA3z

Regional Australia must have – Regional Australia will have – the support it needs to recover and grow from this pandemic. 

#Budget2020 does just that. 

Our regions have the drive, let’s make them thrive. That’s our message today.

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter

This jobs & infrastructure & regional Budget includes a commitment of $62.8 million for the Local Jobs Program in 25 regions across Australia. 

This focuses on reskilling, upskilling & providing employment pathways to help people back into the workforce as the economy recovers.
We are also supporting our manufacturing industries with $1.5 billion in new funding in the Budget for our Modern Manufacturing Strategy.

Trade = jobs & more trade = more jobs

We want to grow our agriculture sector to $100b by 2030.

And our announcement of a number of new measures in this year’s Budget including a significant $328.4m package to support agricultural exporters will help do this.

#RegionsMatter

Our $200 million commitment to Round 5 of our Building Better Regions Fund will deliver regional development - everything from water recycling facilities to refreshed streetscapes. 

It also includes a specific stream for tourism-related infrastructure, worth $100 million.

#2020Budget will make a difference to regional communities all over Australia, incl. through:

● $560m to build the New England Highway’s Singleton Bypass
●$528m for regional rail services for Shepparton & Warrnambool, 
&
● $120m for the Carpentaria Highway Upgrade in the NT

This is a jobs and infrastructure and regional budget.

A record $100 billion 10-year plan now becomes $110 billion from this Budget, delivering a vast range of new projects.

Of this, around $36 billion directly builds regional infrastructure.

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter

To build on regional Australia’s potential – I say: just add water!

We’re more than doubling our investment to water infrastructure, with a further $2 billion now taking the National Water Infrastructure Development Fund to a total of $3.5 billion. 

#RegionsMatter

From the outset of #COVID & restrictions, we saw the immediate need for targeted assistance for our regions. Our $1 billion COVID-19 Relief & Recovery Fund provided timely support when and where it was most critically needed.

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter

This will mean a family-owned trucking company can upgrade or buy a whole new fleet of trucks and write it off in the year of investment. 

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter

More than 99% of businesses can write off the full value of any eligible asset they purchase for their business. 

This will be available to businesses with a turnover up to $5 billion, until June 2022. 

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter

Healthcare is a major concern for regional Australians.
We have allocated more funding to the States & Territories to ensure the availability of services in small rural & regional hospitals.

#RegionsMatter

Just as we are doing with the pandemic, we have invested in practical actions helping farmers, regional businesses and communities through drought now and building resilience for the future.

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter

These are plans which invest in infrastructure, water and services – ensuring regional Australians have as much opportunity as other Australians.

#Budget4theRegions #RegionsMatter
